name: crunchy
content:
crunchy adjective
(SOUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is crunchy, it is firm and makes a short loud noise when it is eaten, pressed, etc. : The toast was delicious, hot, and crunchy. The chips have a crunchy coating. She heard footsteps in the crunchy snow.
music
  informal specialized (of music, especially an electric guitar sound) rough and loud, and often distorted (= made to sound strange and slightly unpleasant): They play crunchy modern rock. a crunchy guitar sound Related word
crunchily
More examplesFewer examplesThe pie filling was sweet and the crust deliciously crunchy.The cereal stays crunchy even with milk poured over it.The seeds add a lovely crunchy texture to the salad.The bread has a crunchy outside and a soft, chewy inside.It sounded like he was eating something crunchy.The dry leaves were crunchy underfoot.The tracks feature drums that sound as if they were recorded in a tin shed, crunchy guitars and grinding bass lines.Distortion pedals produce a crunchier and grittier tone.

crunchy adjective
(PERSON)
US informal sometimes disapproving living in a way that shows you care about the environment and have generally liberal opinions (= accepting and encouraging social change): Using cloth nappies may earn you the title of a crunchy mama. Being crunchy usually means that you don't just go along with mainstream ideas.
More examplesFewer examplesI consider myself a crunchy parent, but after I lost my job I started buying cheap, low-welfare meat.We are not a crunchy, tree-hugging, granola-eating group.
